intro: Tordylium pustulosum, commonly known as the rough-leaved tordylium, is a tropical plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pink in color. The plant has hairy, rough-textured leaves that give it its common name. It is native to parts of Southeast Asia and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Tordylium pustulosum is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and adaptability to various growing conditions.
